skills.name: Rotational symmetry
skills.description: Identify the order of rotational symmetry for regular shapes.

templates.stem: What is the order of rotational symmetry of a regular {sides}-sided polygon?
templates.hint: The order of rotational symmetry equals the number of identical positions when rotating.

templates.stem: What is the order of rotational symmetry of a regular {shape}?
templates.hint: The order of rotational symmetry equals the number of identical positions when rotating.

templates.stem: Which identity correctly expresses tanθ in terms of sinθ and cosθ?
templates.hint: tanθ is defined as sinθ divided by cosθ.

skills.name: Simultaneous equations
skills.description: Solve systems of linear equations

templates.stem: Solve: x + {m}y = {c1}, {n}x + y = {c2}.
templates.hint: Use elimination: subtract a multiple of one equation from the other to isolate a variable.

templates.stem: Solve by substitution: y = {aCoeff}x + {bConst}, {cCoeff}x + {dCoeff}y = {eConst}.
templates.hint: Substitute y into the second equation, solve for x, then back-substitute for y.

skills.name: Stem-and-leaf plots
skills.description: Read and interpret stem-and-leaf plots to find frequencies and statistics.

templates.stem: The stem-and-leaf plot shows test scores. How many students scored in the {targetStem}0s?
templates.hint: Count the leaves in the row that matches your target stem.

templates.stem: From the stem-and-leaf plot of ages, how many people are in their {targetStem}0s?
templates.hint: Count the leaves in the row that matches your target stem.

templates.stem: What is the smallest value shown in the stem-and-leaf plot?
templates.hint: Count the leaves in the row that matches your target stem.

templates.stem: What is the largest value shown in the stem-and-leaf plot?
templates.hint: Count the leaves in the row that matches your target stem.

templates.stem: What is the range of values in the stem-and-leaf plot?
templates.hint: Count the leaves in the row that matches your target stem.

templates.stem: How many data values are shown in total in the stem-and-leaf plot?
templates.hint: Count the leaves in the row that matches your target stem.

templates.stem: What is the median value in the stem-and-leaf plot?
templates.hint: Count the leaves in the row that matches your target stem.

skills.name: Histograms
skills.description: Interpret histograms and read bin counts from bar heights.

templates.stem: The histogram shows the heights of students. How many students are in the {targetBinLabel} cm bin?
templates.answer: (targetBinLabel === '130-140' ? v1 : targetBinLabel === '140-150' ? v2 : targetBinLabel === '150-160' ? v3 : v4)
templates.hint: The height of each bar represents the frequency (how many times that value appears).

templates.stem: The histogram shows the heights of students. How many students are there in total?
templates.hint: The height of each bar represents the frequency (how many times that value appears).

templates.stem: The histogram shows the heights of students. How many students are in the tallest bin (the bin with the most students)?
templates.hint: The height of each bar represents the frequency (how many times that value appears).

templates.stem: The histogram shows the heights of students. How many students are taller than 150 cm?
templates.hint: The height of each bar represents the frequency (how many times that value appears).

templates.stem: The histogram shows the heights of students. How many students are shorter than 150 cm?
templates.hint: The height of each bar represents the frequency (how many times that value appears).

skills.name: Probability with replacement
skills.description: Compute probabilities for sequential events when outcomes are replaced.

templates.stem: A bag has {r} red and {b} blue marbles. You pick one, put it back, then pick another. What is P(red, then red)?
templates.hint: P(A and B) = P(A) * P(B)

templates.stem: A spinner has {red} red sectors and {green} green sectors. You spin twice. What is the probability of getting red both times?
templates.hint: P(A and B) = P(A) * P(B)

skills.name: 3D Nets
skills.description: Recognise nets and identify the 3D solid formed when folded.

templates.stem: Which 3D shape can be formed from the net shown?
templates.hint: Unfold the 3D shape mentally to see all the 2D faces.

templates.stem: The net below folds to form which 3D shape?
templates.hint: Unfold the 3D shape mentally to see all the 2D faces.

templates.stem: Identify the 3D solid that this net makes.
templates.hint: Unfold the 3D shape mentally to see all the 2D faces.

templates.stem: Which 3D shape can be formed from the net shown?
templates.hint: Unfold the 3D shape mentally to see all the 2D faces.

templates.stem: The net below folds to form which 3D solid?
templates.hint: Unfold the 3D shape mentally to see all the 2D faces.

templates.stem: Which solid is made from the net shown?
templates.hint: Unfold the 3D shape mentally to see all the 2D faces.

templates.stem: Identify the 3D shape that the net folds into.
templates.hint: Unfold the 3D shape mentally to see all the 2D faces.

skills.name: Venn Diagrams
skills.description: Use two-set Venn diagrams to calculate overlaps and exclusive counts.

templates.stem: In a class of 30, {s} students play Sport, {m} play Music, and {b} play both. How many students play Sport only?
templates.hint: Review the key concepts and try breaking the problem into smaller steps.

templates.stem: In a class of 28 students, 15 like apples, 17 like bananas and {both} like both. How many students like neither fruit?
templates.hint: Review the key concepts and try breaking the problem into smaller steps.

skills.name: Time, schedules and elapsed time
skills.description: Convert time units, find elapsed time, and interpret schedules and timelines.

templates.stem: How many seconds are in {minutes} minutes?
templates.hint: 1 hour = 60 minutes

templates.stem: Convert {hours} hours to minutes.
templates.hint: 1 hour = 60 minutes

skills.name: Measurement units and conversions
skills.description: Convert between units and solve measurement problems.

templates.stem: A rope is {length} m long. It is cut into pieces of {piece} cm each. How many full pieces can be cut?
templates.hint: 1 metre (m) = 100 centimetres (cm) = 1000 millimetres (mm)

templates.stem: Convert {km} kilometres to metres.
templates.hint: 1 metre (m) = 100 centimetres (cm) = 1000 millimetres (mm)

templates.stem: The temperature was {temp1}°C and increased by {rise}°C. What is the new temperature?
templates.hint: 1 metre (m) = 100 centimetres (cm) = 1000 millimetres (mm)

templates.stem: Convert {g} grams to kilograms.
templates.hint: 1 metre (m) = 100 centimetres (cm) = 1000 millimetres (mm)

skills.name: Composite shapes
skills.description: Calculate perimeter and area of composite shapes.

templates.stem: Find the perimeter of an L-shaped figure made from a {a}×{b} rectangle with a {c}×{d} rectangle cut out from one corner.
templates.hint: Area of rectangle = length * width

skills.name: Volume of prisms
skills.description: Calculate volumes of rectangular and triangular prisms.

templates.stem: Find the volume of a triangular prism with base area {a} cm² and height {h} cm.
templates.hint: Volume of any prism = Area of Base * Height

templates.stem: A swimming pool is {l} m long, {w} m wide and {d} m deep. How many litres of water does it hold when full? (1 m³ = 1000 litres)
templates.hint: Volume of any prism = Area of Base * Height

skills.name: Rational number operations
skills.description: Multiply, divide and simplify operations involving rational numbers.

templates.stem: Calculate: {a}/{b} × {c}/{d}. Give the answer in simplest form.
templates.hint: To multiply fractions: (a/b) * (c/d) = (a*c) / (b*d)

templates.stem: Calculate: ({a}/{b}) ÷ ({c}/{d}). Give the answer in simplest form.
templates.hint: To multiply fractions: (a/b) * (c/d) = (a*c) / (b*d)

skills.name: Negative exponents
skills.description: Understand negative exponents as reciprocals and evaluate them.

templates.stem: Evaluate {b}^-{p}. Write your answer as a fraction.
templates.hint: b^-p = 1 / b^p

templates.stem: Write {base}^-{exp} as a fraction in simplest form.
templates.hint: b^-p = 1 / b^p

skills.name: Fractional exponents
skills.description: Evaluate simple fractional (root) exponents such as square roots.

templates.stem: Evaluate {n}^(1/2).
templates.hint: x^(1/2) = sqrt(x)

templates.stem: Evaluate {base}^(1/3).
templates.hint: x^(1/2) = sqrt(x)

skills.name: Circle Area and Circumference
skills.description: Calculate circumference and area of circles using π ≈ 3.14.

templates.stem: Find the circumference of a circle with radius {r} cm. Use π ≈ 3.14.
templates.hint: Circumference (C) = 2 * π * radius (r)  OR  C = π * diameter (d)

templates.stem: Find the area of a circle with radius {r} cm. Use π ≈ 3.14.
templates.hint: Circumference (C) = 2 * π * radius (r)  OR  C = π * diameter (d)

skills.name: Rate word problems
skills.description: Solve problems linking distance, time and speed (rates).

templates.stem: A car travels {d} km in {t} hours. What is its average speed in km/h? (Round your answer to 2 decimal places)
templates.hint: Speed = Distance / Time

templates.stem: A machine fills bottles at a rate of {rate} litres per minute. How many minutes will it take to fill a {volume}-litre container? (Give answer to 1 decimal place if needed)
templates.hint: Speed = Distance / Time

templates.stem: Petrol costs ${price} per litre. How much will it cost to fill a {volume}-litre tank? (Answer to nearest cent)
templates.hint: Speed = Distance / Time

skills.name: Compound probability with replacement
skills.description: Compute compound probabilities for independent events with replacement.

templates.stem: A coin is flipped and a 6-sided die is rolled. What is P(heads and a {n})?
templates.hint: P(A and B) = P(A) * P(B)

templates.stem: Two fair dice are rolled. What is the probability that both show a number {condition}?
templates.hint: P(A and B) = P(A) * P(B)

skills.name: Time & Money
skills.description: Convert and calculate using units of time and money.

templates.stem: Convert {h} hour(s) to minutes.
How many cents are in ${dollars}?
Convert {ml} millilitres to litres.
How many minutes is {hours} hours and {mins} minutes?
An item costs ${p} dollars. You pay with ${paid} dollars. How much change should you get?

skills.name: Problem solving
skills.description: Simple multi-step word problems with arithmetic.

templates.stem: You have {total} items and want to pack them in boxes that hold {per_box} items each. How many boxes will you need?
templates.hint: Review the key concepts and try breaking the problem into smaller steps.

templates.stem: A recipe needs {flourCups} cups of flour. If you want to double the recipe, how much flour do you need?
templates.hint: Review the key concepts and try breaking the problem into smaller steps.

skills.name: Multi-step linear equations
skills.description: Solve linear equations requiring multiple algebraic steps.

templates.stem: Solve for x: {a}(x + {b}) = {c}
templates.hint: Balance Method: Whatever operation you apply to one side of the equation, you must apply to the other side.

templates.stem: Solve for x: {a}x + {b} = {c}x + {d}
templates.hint: Balance Method: Whatever operation you apply to one side of the equation, you must apply to the other side.

skills.name: Transversals and parallel lines
skills.description: Use angle relationships to find missing angles in transversal diagrams.

templates.stem: Two parallel lines are cut by a transversal. If an alternate interior angle is {a}°, what is its corresponding angle?
templates.hint: Corresponding angles are equal, alternate angles are equal.

templates.stem: Two parallel lines are cut by a transversal. If a corresponding angle is {a}°, what is its matching angle?
templates.hint: Corresponding angles are equal, alternate angles are equal.

templates.stem: Two parallel lines are cut by a transversal. If an alternate exterior angle is {a}°, what is its equal angle?
templates.hint: Corresponding angles are equal, alternate angles are equal.

templates.stem: Two parallel lines are cut by a transversal. If one same-side interior (consecutive interior) angle is {a}°, what is the measure of its supplementary partner?
templates.hint: Corresponding angles are equal, alternate angles are equal.

templates.stem: At the intersection of two lines, one angle measures {a}°. What is the measure of the vertically opposite angle?
templates.hint: Review the key concepts and try breaking the problem into smaller steps.

skills.name: Transformations on the coordinate plane
skills.description: Perform reflections and rotations of points on the coordinate plane.

templates.stem: Reflect the point ({x},{y}) across the y-axis.
templates.hint: Reflection across x-axis: (x, y) -> (x, -y)

templates.stem: Rotate the point ({x},{y}) 90° clockwise around the origin (0,0).
templates.hint: Reflection across x-axis: (x, y) -> (x, -y)

skills.name: Surface area of prisms and cylinders
skills.description: Calculate surface area of prisms and cylinders using standard formulas.

templates.stem: Find the surface area of a rectangular prism with length {l} cm, width {w} cm, and height {h} cm.
templates.hint: Surface Area of Rectangular Prism = 2(lw + lh + wh)

templates.stem: Find the surface area of a cylinder with radius {r} cm and height {h} cm. Use π ≈ 3.14.
templates.hint: Surface Area of Rectangular Prism = 2(lw + lh + wh)

skills.name: Scatter plots and correlation
skills.description: Interpret scatter plots and describe correlation and trends.

templates.stem: {scenario}. What type of correlation does this show?

scenario: A scatter plot shows hours studied vs. test scores. As hours studied increase, test scores increase
A scatter plot shows temperature vs. ice cream sales. As temperature increases, sales increase
A scatter plot shows advertising spending vs. product sales. As advertising increases, sales increase
A scatter plot shows years of education vs. annual income. As education increases, income increases
A scatter plot shows plant growth vs. amount of sunlight. As sunlight increases, growth increases

templates.hint: Review the key concepts and try breaking the problem into smaller steps.

templates.stem: {scenario}. What type of correlation does this show?

scenario: A scatter plot shows hours of TV watched vs. test scores. As TV hours increase, test scores decrease
A scatter plot shows age of car vs. resale value. As car age increases, resale value decreases
A scatter plot shows exercise hours per week vs. resting heart rate. As exercise increases, heart rate decreases
A scatter plot shows price of a product vs. quantity sold. As price increases, quantity sold decreases
A scatter plot shows distance from city center vs. house prices. As distance increases, prices decrease
A scatter plot shows altitude vs. temperature. As altitude increases, temperature decreases

templates.hint: Review the key concepts and try breaking the problem into smaller steps.

skills.name: Standard form operations
skills.description: Multiply and divide numbers written in standard (scientific) form.

templates.stem: Calculate ({m1} x 10^{e1}) × ({m2} x 10^{e2}). Write in standard form.

skills.name: Systems of linear equations
skills.description: Solve systems of two linear equations in two variables.

templates.stem: Solve the following system of equations for x and y: y = {m}x + {c} and y = {m2}x + {c2}. Give your answer in the form x,y rounded to 2 decimal places if needed.
templates.hint: Do the same operation to both sides of the equation.

skills.name: Radical expressions
skills.description: Simplify square roots into surd form.

templates.stem: Simplify the following radical expression: √{n}.
templates.hint: sqrt(a * b) = sqrt(a) * sqrt(b)

skills.name: Graphing linear inequalities
skills.description: Identify the correct graphical representation of a linear inequality.

templates.stem: Is the solution region for the inequality y < {m}x + {c} above or below the line? Answer "above" or "below".
templates.hint: For < or >: use a dashed boundary line (points on the line are NOT included).

skills.name: Midpoint formula
skills.description: Find the midpoint of a line segment given two endpoints.

templates.stem: Find the midpoint of the line segment with endpoints ({x1}, {y1}) and ({x2}, {y2}).
templates.hint: Midpoint (x, y) = ((x1 + x2)/2, (y1 + y2)/2)

skills.name: Composite 3D solids
skills.description: Find the volume of composite solids built from basic shapes.

templates.stem: A solid is formed by placing a cone with radius {r} cm and height {h_cone} cm on top of a cylinder with the same radius and height {h_cyl} cm. What is the total volume of the solid? Use π ≈ 3.14.
templates.hint: Volume of Cylinder = π * r² * h

skills.name: One-variable inequalities
skills.description: Solve linear inequalities and express solution ranges using inequality notation.

templates.stem: Solve for x: {a}x + {b} < {c}
templates.hint: For ax + b > c, ax + b ≥ c, ax + b < c, or ax + b ≤ c

templates.stem: Solve for x: {b} - {a}x ≥ {c}
templates.hint: For ax + b > c, ax + b ≥ c, ax + b < c, or ax + b ≤ c

skills.name: Nonlinear functions
skills.description: Evaluate and work with nonlinear functions such as quadratics.

templates.stem: If f(x) = x² + {a}, find f({v}).
templates.hint: Quadratic: y = ax² + bx + c

templates.stem: If f(x) = {b} * {a}^x, find f({v}).
templates.hint: Quadratic: y = ax² + bx + c

skills.name: Expressions and polynomials
skills.description: Expand and simplify polynomial expressions.

templates.stem: Expand and simplify: (x − {a})(x + {b}).
templates.hint: Monomial, binomial, trinomial

skills.name: Equations and inequalities
skills.description: Solve linear equations and inequalities.

templates.stem: Solve the inequality: {a}x + {b} ≥ {c}
templates.hint: Substitution, elimination methods

skills.name: Multiply and divide polynomials
skills.description: Expand, multiply and divide polynomial expressions and simplify.

templates.stem: Expand and simplify: {a}x( {b}x + {c} ).
templates.hint: (a + b)(c + d) = ac + ad + bc + bd

templates.stem: Divide {a}x³ + {a*b}x² − {a*c}x by {a}x.
templates.hint: (a + b)(c + d) = ac + ad + bc + bd

skills.name: Compound probability (counting principle)
skills.description: Use counting principles to compute probabilities for combined events.

templates.stem: A restaurant offers {m} main courses and {d} desserts. How many different two-course meals are possible?
templates.hint: Total ways = n₁ × n₂ × … × nₖ

skills.name: Volume and surface area of cones and spheres
skills.description: Apply formulas to find volume and surface area of cones and spheres.

templates.stem: Find the volume of a sphere with radius {r} cm. Use π ≈ 3.14.
templates.hint: Cone volume: V = (1/3)πr²h

templates.stem: Find the surface area of a sphere with radius {r} cm. Use π ≈ 3.14.
templates.hint: Cone volume: V = (1/3)πr²h

templates.stem: Find the volume of a cone with radius {r} cm and height {h} cm. Use π ≈ 3.14.
templates.hint: Cone volume: V = (1/3)πr²h

skills.name: Box plots and quartiles
skills.description: Read box plots and calculate quartiles, medians and interquartile range.

templates.stem: For the data set shown in the box plot, what is the interquartile range (IQR)?
templates.hint: IQR = Q3 - Q1

templates.stem: A bag has {r} red, {b} blue and {g} green counters. What is the probability of picking a red counter?
templates.hint: Probability = favorable / total

templates.stem: What is the mean of {a}, {b}, and {c}?
templates.hint: Probability = favorable / total

templates.stem: A data set has values {a}, {b}, {c}, {d}. What is the median?
templates.hint: Probability = favorable / total

templates.stem: A data set has values {a}, {b}, {c}, {d}, {e}. What is the range?
templates.hint: Probability = favorable / total

skills.name: Geometric sequences
skills.description: Recognise geometric sequences and find common ratio and nth term.

templates.stem: A geometric sequence starts with {a} and has a common ratio of {r}. What is the 4th term?
templates.hint: aₙ = a₁ × r^(n-1)

skills.name: Integer division
skills.description: Perform division with integers and express remainders.

templates.stem: Divide {a} by {b}. Give the quotient and remainder in the form q r r.
templates.hint: Negative × negative = positive

skills.name: Ratios and proportions
skills.description: Solve proportion problems.

templates.stem: If {a} items cost ${cost}, how much do {b} items cost?
templates.hint: a/b = c/d → a×d = b×c

skills.name: Consumer percentages
skills.description: Calculate discounts, markups, and compound percentages.

templates.stem: A jacket is ${price}. It has a {d1}% discount, then an additional {d2}% off the sale price. What is the final price?
templates.hint: Discount = original × (percent/100)

skills.name: Measurement conversions and calculations
skills.description: Convert units and calculate areas and volumes.

templates.stem: A pool is {l} m long, {w} m wide, and {h} m deep. How many litres of water does it hold?
templates.hint: 1 cubic metre (m³) = 1000 litres (L)

skills.name: Problem solving with algebra
skills.description: Solve real-world problems using algebraic reasoning.

templates.stem: A car travels {d} km in {t} hours. What is its average speed in km/h?
templates.hint: Review the key concepts and try breaking the problem into smaller steps.

skills.name: Coordinate plane applications
skills.description: Find distances, midpoints, and gradients on the coordinate plane.

templates.stem: What is the distance between ({x1},{y1}) and ({x2},{y2})? (Round to 1 decimal place)
templates.hint: Distance formula: d = sqrt((x2 - x1)² + (y2 - y1)²)

skills.name: Angle relationships
skills.description: Use properties of parallel lines, triangles, and polygons.

templates.stem: Two parallel lines are cut by a transversal. One angle is {a}°. What is the corresponding angle?
templates.hint: Sum of interior angles of a polygon with n sides = (n - 2) * 180 degrees.

skills.name: Transformations
skills.description: Perform and describe rotations, reflections, and translations.

templates.stem: Point ({x},{y}) is rotated 90° clockwise about the origin. What are the new coordinates?
templates.hint: Translation: (x,y) → (x+a, y+b)

skills.name: Pythagoras in 3D
skills.description: Apply Pythagoras' theorem to 3D problems.

templates.stem: A rectangular box has dimensions {l} × {w} × {h}. What is the length of the space diagonal? (Round to 1 decimal place)
templates.hint: Face diagonal: √(l² + w²)

skills.name: Arithmetic sequences
skills.description: Find terms and sums of arithmetic sequences.

templates.stem: An arithmetic sequence has first term {a} and common difference {d}. What is the {n}th term?
templates.hint: Arithmetic: aₙ = a₁ + (n-1)d

skills.name: Quadratic formula
skills.description: Solve quadratic equations that cannot be factored using the quadratic formula.

templates.stem: Use the quadratic formula to solve {a}x^2 + {b}x + {c} = 0. Give your answers to two decimal places.
templates.hint: The formula: x = [-b ± sqrt(b² - 4ac)] / (2a)

skills.name: Graphing quadratics
skills.description: Identify key features of quadratic graphs such as the vertex.

templates.stem: What are the coordinates of the vertex of the parabola y = x^2 + {b}x + {c}?
templates.hint: For y = ax² + bx + c: Vertex x-coordinate = -b / (2a)

skills.name: Sine and cosine rules
skills.description: Use the Sine and Cosine Rules to solve non-right-angled triangles.

templates.stem: In a triangle, side a = {a}, side b = {b}, and the angle between them is C = {C}°. Find the length of side c using the Cosine Rule. Give your answer to 1 decimal place.
templates.hint: Sine Rule: a/sin(A) = b/sin(B) = c/sin(C) (Use when you have a 'matching pair' of a side and its opposite angle).

skills.name: Algebraic fractions
skills.description: Simplify algebraic fractions using factorisation and cancellation.

templates.stem: Simplify the expression: (x^2 - {a*a}) / (x - {a}).
templates.hint: Review the key concepts and try breaking the problem into smaller steps.

skills.name: Circle theorems
skills.description: Apply circle theorems for angles at the centre and circumference.

templates.stem: An angle at the circumference subtended by an arc is {a}°. What is the angle at the centre subtended by the same arc?
templates.hint: Angle at the centre is twice the angle at the circumference.

skills.name: Conditional probability and tree diagrams
skills.description: Solve conditional probability problems using fractions and tree diagrams.

templates.stem: A bag contains {r} red and {b} blue marbles. Two marbles are drawn without replacement. What is the probability that both are red? Give your answer in simplest form.
templates.hint: P(A and B) = P(A) * P(B) (for independent events)

skills.name: Systems of equations (advanced)
skills.description: Solve systems that include both linear and quadratic equations.

templates.stem: Find the positive x-coordinate of the intersection points of the line y = {c} and the parabola y = x^2 - {a}. Give your answer to 2 decimal places.
templates.hint: Substitution is the most common method.

skills.name: Trigonometry in 3D
skills.description: Apply trigonometry to find angles and lengths in 3D shapes.

templates.stem: A rectangular prism has length {l}, width {w}, and height {h}. Find the angle the space diagonal makes with the base, in degrees. Give your answer to 1 decimal place.
templates.hint: Pythagoras' Theorem (repeated application to find diagonals).

skills.name: Functions, domain and range
skills.description: Interpret functions and describe their domains and ranges.

templates.stem: What is the domain of the function f(x) = sqrt(x - {a})? Give your answer in the form x >= a.
templates.hint: For square root functions, the expression under the root must be >= 0.

skills.name: Bivariate statistics
skills.description: Interpret lines of best fit and make predictions.

templates.stem: A line of best fit for a scatter plot is y = {m}x + {c}. Predict the value of y when x = {x_val}.
templates.hint: Review the key concepts and try breaking the problem into smaller steps.

skills.name: Surface area and volume (multi-step)
skills.description: Solve multi-step problems involving surface area and volume.

templates.stem: A cone has a slant height of {s} cm and a radius of {r} cm. What is its volume? Use π ≈ 3.14.
templates.hint: Pythagoras' Theorem: a² + b² = c² (often needed to find heights or radii)

skills.name: Geometric reasoning and proofs
skills.description: Reason with geometric properties and angle relationships.

templates.stem: In a cyclic quadrilateral, one angle is {a}°. What is the measure of the opposite angle?
templates.hint: Opposite angles in a cyclic quadrilateral add up to 180 degrees.

skills.name: Financial Rates
skills.description: Financial Rates questions for Year 10

templates.stem: A laptop originally costs ${price}. It is on sale with a {percent}% discount. What is the sale price?
templates.hint: Rate = amount / time or amount / quantity

skills.name: Financial Compound
skills.description: Financial Compound questions for Year 10

templates.stem: ${p} is invested at {r}% p.a. compounded annually for {t} years. Find the final amount to the nearest cent.
templates.hint: A = P(1 + r/n)^(nt)

skills.name: Precision Error
skills.description: Precision Error questions for Year 10

templates.stem: A length is measured as {m} cm, correct to the nearest {unit} cm. What is the greatest possible error?
templates.hint: Relative error = |error| / true value

skills.name: Volume Similar
skills.description: Volume Similar questions for Year 10

templates.stem: Two similar cones have heights in the ratio {ratio1} : {ratio2}. The smaller cone has volume {v} cm³. Find the volume of the larger cone.
templates.hint: Volume ratio = k³

skills.name: Coord Distance
skills.description: Coord Distance questions for Year 10

templates.stem: Find the distance between the points ({x1}, {y1}) and ({x2}, {y2}). Give your answer to 1 decimal place.
templates.hint: Distance: √((x₂-x₁)² + (y₂-y₁)²)

skills.name: Coord Gradient
skills.description: Coord Gradient questions for Year 10

templates.stem: Find the gradient of the line passing through ({x1}, {y1}) and ({x2}, {y2}). Simplify fully.
templates.hint: m = (y₂ - y₁)/(x₂ - x₁)

skills.name: Nonlinear Graph
skills.description: Nonlinear Graph questions for Year 10

templates.stem: The quadratic y = x² + {b}x + {c} has two x-intercepts. What is their sum?
templates.hint: Quadratic: vertex form y = a(x-h)² + k

skills.name: Similar Triangles
skills.description: Similar Triangles questions for Year 10

templates.stem: Two similar triangles have corresponding sides {s1} cm and {s2} cm. A side of {len} cm on the smaller triangle corresponds to what length on the larger triangle? (1 decimal place)
templates.hint: Side ratio = scale factor k

skills.name: Congruent Sss
skills.description: Congruent Sss questions for Year 10

templates.stem: Triangle ABC has sides {a}, {b}, {c} cm. Triangle DEF has sides {d}, {e}, {f} cm. Are the triangles congruent by SSS?
templates.hint: SSS, SAS, ASA, AAS, RHS (right-angle hypotenuse-side)

skills.name: Univariate Boxplot
skills.description: Univariate Boxplot questions for Year 10

templates.stem: A data set has Q1 = {q1} and Q3 = {q3}. What is the interquartile range (IQR)?
templates.hint: Outlier if > Q3 + 1.5×IQR or < Q1 - 1.5×IQR

skills.name: Bivariate Correlation
skills.description: Bivariate Correlation questions for Year 10

templates.stem: What type of correlation does this scatter plot show? Select from: strong positive, moderate positive, weak positive, no correlation, weak negative, moderate negative, strong negative
templates.hint: r ≈ 1 strong positive, r ≈ -1 strong negative

skills.name: Quadratics Complete Square
skills.description: Quadratics Complete Square questions for Year 11

templates.stem: Write in completed-square form: x² + {b}x + {c}
templates.hint: x² + bx → (x + b/2)² - (b/2)²

skills.name: Surface Area Pyramid
skills.description: Surface Area Pyramid questions for Year 11

templates.stem: A square pyramid has base side {s} cm and triangular face slant height {l} cm. Find the total surface area.
templates.hint: Lateral area = (1/2) × perimeter × slant height

skills.name: Volume Sphere
skills.description: Volume Sphere questions for Year 11

templates.stem: Find the volume of a sphere with radius {r} cm. Use π ≈ 3.14 and round to the nearest whole number.
templates.hint: V = (4/3)πr³

skills.name: Trig Graph
skills.description: Trig Graph questions for Year 11

templates.stem: How many solutions does sin(x) = {k} have in the interval 0° ≤ x < 360°?
templates.hint: y = a sin(b(x-c)) + d

skills.name: Matrix Add
skills.description: Matrix Add questions for Year 11

templates.hint: [a b; c d] + [e f; g h] = [a+e b+f; c+g d+h]

skills.name: Matrix Multiply 2x2
skills.description: Matrix Multiply 2x2 questions for Year 11

templates.stem: Calculate AB where A = [[{a},{b}],[{c},{d}]] and B = [[{e},{f}],[{g},{h}]].
templates.hint: [a b; c d] × [e f; g h] = [ae+bg af+bh; ce+dg cf+dh]

skills.name: Quadratic Eqs
skills.description: Quadratic Eqs questions for Year 11

templates.stem: Solve x^2 + {aCoeff}x + {bCoeff} = 0 by factoring.
templates.hint: Write the quadratic as (x - r1)(x - r2) = 0 and set each factor to zero.

templates.stem: Solve {aCoeff}x^2 + {bCoeff}x + {cCoeff} = 0 using the quadratic formula.
Find the discriminant of {a}x^2 + {b}x + {c} = 0 and describe the nature of its roots.

params.wrongNatureA: {nature === 'two distinct real roots' ? 'one repeated real root' : 'two distinct real roots'}
params.wrongNatureB: {nature === 'no real roots' ? 'two distinct real roots' : 'no real roots'}

templates.hint: The discriminant is b^2 - 4ac: positive (two roots), zero (one repeated root), negative (no real roots).

templates.stem: Complete the square for the equation x^2 + {a}x + {b} = 0

skills.name: Polynomials
skills.description: Polynomials questions for Year 11

templates.stem: Expand ({a}x + {b})({c}x + {d})
templates.hint: Even degree positive leading coeff → up on both sides

templates.stem: Factor {aCoeff}x^2 + {bCoeff}x + {cCoeff}.
templates.hint: Work backwards from (mx + p)(nx + q) so the product matches the original quadratic.

templates.stem: Simplify ({a}x² + {b}x + {c}) + ({d}x² + {e}x + {f})
templates.hint: Even degree positive leading coeff → up on both sides

skills.name: Trig Ratios
skills.description: Trig Ratios questions for Year 11

templates.stem: In a right-angled triangle, opposite side = {opp} cm, adjacent side = {adj} cm. Find tan θ exactly.
templates.hint: sin θ = opp/hyp, cos θ = adj/hyp, tan θ = opp/adj

templates.stem: A right triangle has hypotenuse {hyp} cm and opposite side {opp} cm. Find sin θ exactly.
templates.hint: sin θ = opp/hyp, cos θ = adj/hyp, tan θ = opp/adj

skills.name: Trig Identities
skills.description: Trig Identities questions for Year 11

templates.stem: Simplify {identity.expr}, expressing your answer using only {identity.showOnly}.
templates.hint: sin²θ + cos²θ = 1

skills.name: Coordinate Geometry
skills.description: Coordinate Geometry questions for Year 11

templates.stem: Find the gradient of the line passing through ({x1},{y1}) and ({x2},{y2}).
templates.hint: (x-h)² + (y-k)² = r²

templates.stem: Find the distance between ({x1},{y1}) and ({x2},{y2}). Give exact simplified form.
templates.hint: (x-h)² + (y-k)² = r²

skills.name: Descriptive Stats
skills.description: Descriptive Stats questions for Year 11

templates.stem: Find the mean of the numbers {a}, {b}, {c}, {d}, {e}.
templates.hint: Variance = Σ(x - μ)² / n

skills.name: Calculus Diff
skills.description: Calculus Diff questions for Year 11

templates.stem: Differentiate f(x) = {a}x² + {b}x + {c}
templates.hint: Power rule: d/dx(xⁿ) = nx^(n-1)

skills.name: Add and subtract complex numbers
skills.description: Complex number operations

templates.stem: Simplify ({a} + {b}i) + ({c} + {d}i).
templates.hint: (a + bi) + (c + di) = (a + c) + (b + d)i

skills.name: Dot product
skills.description: Vector dot product

templates.stem: Find the dot product of <{a},{b}> and <{c},{d}>.
templates.hint: u · v = u₁v₁ + u₂v₂ + u₃v₃

skills.name: Angle between vectors
skills.description: Find angle between vectors

templates.stem: Find the angle between <{a},{b}> and <{c},{d}> to the nearest degree.
templates.hint: cos θ = (u · v) / (|u||v|)

skills.name: Matrix operations
skills.description: Matrix operations

templates.stem: Find the determinant of the matrix [[{a},{b}],[{c},{d}]]
templates.hint: A + B (same dimensions): add corresponding entries

skills.name: Vector operations
skills.description: Vector operations

templates.stem: Calculate the dot product <{a},{b}> · <{c},{d}>
templates.hint: u + v = <u₁ + v₁, u₂ + v₂>

skills.name: Find terms of a recursive sequence
skills.description: Recursive sequences

templates.stem: A sequence is defined by T(1) = {t1}, T(n) = {a}·T(n-1) + {b} for n ≥ 2. Find T({n}).
templates.hint: a₁ = initial value

skills.name: Product property of logarithms
skills.description: Logarithm properties

templates.stem: Simplify log({a}) + log({b}) where the logarithm has the same base
templates.hint: log₆ (xy) = log₆ x + log₆ y

skills.name: Sum and difference rules
skills.description: Derivative rules

templates.stem: A particle moves according to s(t) = {a}t² + {b}t + {c}. Find its velocity at t = {t}.
templates.hint: d/dx [f(x) + g(x)] = f'(x) + g'(x)

skills.name: Complex Numbers
skills.description: Complex Numbers questions for Year 13

templates.stem: Find the complex conjugate of {a} + {b}i
templates.hint: i² = -1
